reviews.review: Dobrá hra až na pár bugů

As someone who absolutely loves Half Life, this game has disappointed me. It's one of the most frustrating experience i've ever had while playing a video game. The game does a terrible job in delivering health packs and that coupled with the god awful amount of action going on means you're dying all the time. Along with that, the terrible AI (marines which are supposed to protect you, actually shoot you at times), frequent glitches (I got stuck on the elevator floors due to which i had to revert to previous save) and frequent crashes make the already bad experience even worse. 

The only and LITERALLY the only thing which this game does good are the new BADASS weapons (really-really loved the fuck off to the xen gun), but thats about it in my opinion. Blueshift was a way better expansion to be honest.

Phenomenal. I actually might like this game better than the original Half Life, but only by a small margin. The games atmosphere gives off a palpable sense of isolation that is punctuated by running into your team mates every so often (who are actually very useful)! The soundtrack is very good and used sparingly to great effect, if you liked the original Half Life you'll love this game!

Half-Life: Opposing Force is a game made by Valve where you play as Adrian Shephard, a Hazardous Environment Combat Unit (HECU) that plays within the same timeframe of the gameplay of the original [i]Half-Life[/i].

(Spoiler from Half-Life) [s]Adrian gets his mission started to get Morgan Freeman.[/s] Adrian will encounter lots of enemies along the way, such as many of the similar types of aliens you encounter from Half-Life, some newer aliens, as well as the Black Ops. You will interact with the scientists and other HECU units to help you along the way as they assist you in progressing through the game. You get to do a few extra things in this game, such as climb and swing from ropes, get some new weapons, and you'll listen into HECU radios that will inform you about your mission and the progress of the alien invasion.

The visuals seem to run off the same engine as the original Half-Life (not surprising) as well as many of the audio tracks and sound effects are very nostalgic.

I like how Valve was able to give us a different viewpoint of the alien invasion from Half-Life, but change it up from the original game. I think this game does a good job of portraying what the HECU would've been doing during the alien invasion at Black Mesa and they did it pretty well. The only underwhelming thing I think this game suffers from is the final boss, which isn't very difficult once you get the rhythm down (like most games). Anyway, I would recommend this game to not only complete your Valve collection, but to also enjoy Half-Life in a new viewpoint.

Opposing Force is an interesting story that runs in parallel with that of Half-Life. It builds a more complete picture of the events that unfolded at Black Mesa, as well as building a solid foundation for future releases in this series. Many new weapons and enemies are introduced with an emphasis on those of alien origin.

Of the two major Half-Life expansion packs, Opposing Force is definitely my favourite partly because it feels more expanded than Blue Shift since you have new enemies, new weapons, the capacity to build a squad and additional means of traversing environments, none of which you have with the latter. One aspect of Op For that I really appreciated was that my expectations of the game's objectives were subverted considerably in a way that makes the HECU almost sympathetic. 
Gameplay is very much familiar with only the new methods of getting around levels - namely rope climbing and using the Barnacles to pull you across - being the newest learning curve but both are pretty straightforward. The new weapons are pretty good and as with Half-Life titles, you have to be strategic with the weapons you use as ammo is pretty scarce though you can use the Displacer Cannon to transport to Xen to find new ammo for most weapon types though you need a large quantity of depleted uranium ammo in the first place to make the transport. Building a squad in the game with other HECU marines is a really nice feature (revolutionary when Op For was first released) where you can order more heavily armed marines with the SAW to cover you while the medics could help give a health boost out on the field and engineers can cut through doors. Sometimes they're not essential but there are occasions where it is not possible to progress throughout the game without their help so it is in your best interests to keep safeguard your squad.
In terms of the new Race X aliens, you often have to take a stance using cover and strafing much more than other Half-Life titles as the Shock Troopers have significant offensive strength and the Pit Drones have strength in numbers whilst the Voltigores are ammo sponges that can be deadly in close quarters, where you will often find them.
As much as I enjoyed Blue Shift, Op For is by far the better game to me, also helped by the latter taking a couple of hours longer to complete in addition to the new content available whilst the former is more about creating exposition that sets up Half-Life 2. The biggest criticism I have of Op For is an unresolved bug where you become stuck in position, most frequently so when you travel down an elevator, only being able to look around and forcing you to reload from a point before you got in the elevator. The only resolution I've found is to keep jumping in the elevator until it stops moving so you don't get stuck.
Les graphismes et la difficulté sont d'époque mais ça continue de faire le taf!

Klasyk! Druga odsłona pierwszego Half-Life'a. Nie będę pisać tu nic dla osób, które w nią już grały - bo wszystko wiecie.
Dla kogoś kto nigdy nie miał tej gry - jeśli zainteresowała Cię jakaś część Half-life, czy nawet remake Half-life, Black Mesa to zagraj w każdą część, poznaj przeszłość tej gry, fabułę - alternatywne spojrzenie od strony żołnierzy z jednostki HECU. Znajdziesz tu wiele odpowiedzi, na które gracz zadał sobie pytanie podczas pierwszej części tej fajnej gry. 
Pamiętaj! Nie patrz przez pryzmat nowych gier - jej początki sięgają 1997 roku - porównaj ją do standardów gier z 1997 i zrozumiesz, że ta gra była niesamowitym przeskokiem w grach.

An amazing game

If you got any respect for the Half-Life franchise at all, take a huge step around this one. The GoldSource engine didn't age well, but where the original Half-Life game is carrying its dated environment with a certain sense of retro-nostalgic pride, Opposing Force at best shows how easy it is to fail the test of time.

I don't have enough toes and fingers to count in one gesture how many times I had to reload a quick save not due to challenge, but from getting stuck in elevators or cliffs from climbing up the god-awful ropes. Half the weapons in this game are forgettable and have no reason to be there other than some person at the dev conference brainstorming as much garbage as possible.

The only redeeming factor about this game at all is the ending, so do yourself a favor and watch a walkthrough on YouTube or something – you most certainly won't miss anything of importance.
Aged quite well. For its time, Opposing Force was a really good add-on and it is still enjoyable today. Not boad for a 1999 shooter.
"I bet you can get lost in this place real easy."

One of my fave entries in the Half-Life series. It took the fun bits from the first HL and condensed it into an action-packed game. Some puzzles are copy-pasted from the first game, and a few of the new alien designs are uninspired, but it does away with miles of headcrab-infested vents and searching three separate rooms for the odd valve or button to interact with before making progress again. I think it's definitely worth a try especially if you liked the first game.

The story is told through an alternative perspective of a Marine grunt, one of many who were being flown in to bring things in the research facility under control. It clears up the aftermath of the Black Mesa incident and prepares ground for the events of Half-Life 2. Shephard is a bona fide badass and I hope to see him return in a future game.
Best addon to a game ever with amazing gameplay and story new weapons new guy and new enemies

Если в оригинальной игре напарники это кусок говна, то тут ими можно пользоваться! Тем более, они нужны в некоторых местах для прохождения. Понравилась пасхалка, когда на стене висит фото "Работник месяца" и там Гордон. Всем рекомендую.

[h1] <<Забудьте о Фримане>> или как НАТО обделались в Нью-Мехико [/h1] 

[i] - Шикарное дополнение, которое повествует нам о тяжелых буднях Адриана Шепарда - капрала морской пехоты США. Нелегкая судьба занесла бедолагу в Черную Мезу, где он будет разгребать лопатой (в его случае - разводным ключом) последствия от каскадного резонанса (спасибо Гордону). [/i] 

[b] Не буду тут писать про графон, геймплей, сюжет и т.д.
Просто скажу, что это очень годное дополнение, где появились новые локации, монстры, пушки и фичи.
Не могу не отметить то, что эта игра - одна сплошная отсылка. если вы знакомы с такими шедеврами, например "Чужие" или "Звездные Войны".
А, чуть не забыл, саундтрек тут тоже божественный. Прям очень похож местами на саунд из Чужих. [/b]

Of course Gearbox's name has been tarnished with absolute failures like DNF, this game is a masterpiece and provides enough content and difficulty that in some areas it is even better than the base game of Half-Life 1. Однозначно лучше оригинальной игры.В первой Халфе хоть и был сюжет получше,но там всё слишком сильно притянуто за уши.Уже где-то после 50% пройденного сюжета становится скучновато,враги всё приходят и приходят,а здесь хоть и игра короткая,но постоянно держит в напряжении,всё время драйвово,и не бывает скучно,заглянул за угол а там сюрприз.И конечно же новые виды оружия,врагов,локаций делает всё намного круче и драйвовее.Однозначно 10 довольных замороженных Шеппардов из 10!
